FIELD.NAME: type
FIELD.COMMENT: This references a qual structure level ,e.g. standard criteria, numeric criteria, etc...

FIELD.NAME: subcrittype
FIELD.COMMENT: If this is a sub criteria it might be different from normal criteria. E.g. it might act as a range or a range's criterion.

TABLE.NAME: bcgt_form_elements
TABLE.COMMENT: Default comment for the table, please edit me

TABLE.NAME: bcgt_unit_build_attributes
TABLE.COMMENT: For storing default values of things for units, as we can only store against structureid and levelid, we could have the unit on numerous qualification builds

TABLE.NAME: bcgt_user_qual_units
TABLE.COMMENT: Linking which units the students are doing on their qualifications

TABLE.NAME: bcgt_user_ranges
TABLE.COMMENT: Storing the range criteria points/values for students

FIELD.NAME: value
FIELD.COMMENT: Could be a points score, a 0/1 (achieved), etc...

TABLE.NAME: bcgt_unit_award_points
TABLE.COMMENT: This table is used for setting different points for unit awards at different unit levels. Used in BTEC award calculations.

TABLE.NAME: bcgt_user_qual_awards
TABLE.COMMENT: Default comment for the table, please edit me

TABLE.NAME: bcgt_user_grades
TABLE.COMMENT: Default comment for the table, please edit me

FIELD.NAME: grade
FIELD.COMMENT: Either an id of a qual_award record, or can just be a text grade manually input if the record is against a course instead of a valid qual

TABLE.NAME: bcgt_activity_refs
TABLE.COMMENT: Default comment for the table, please edit me

FIELD.NAME: partid
FIELD.COMMENT: If the module uses parts (e.g. turnitin) this is the id of the part we are linked to

TABLE.NAME: bcgt_mods
TABLE.COMMENT: Default comment for the table, please edit me

FIELD.NAME: parttable
FIELD.COMMENT: If the mod breaks the activity down into parts, like turnitin does, this is the table the parts are stored in

FIELD.NAME: partmodcol
FIELD.COMMENT: Is the mod uses parts, this column references the instance id from the module part

FIELD.NAME: submissionstatuscol
FIELD.COMMENT: The column that holds the submissions status, e.g. "submitted", "new", "draft", etc... Can be null if this mod doesn't use one

FIELD.NAME: submissionstatusval
FIELD.COMMENT: The value expected in the submissionstatuscol if the submission is valid. e.g. "submitted", "completed", etc... Can be null if not used by this mod
